marketNews.title: BI Rate Held at 4.75%, Outside Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (22/10) kept the BI Rate at 4.75%, contrary to the consensus expectation of a 25 basis point cut. The lending facility and deposit facility were also maintained at 5.5% and 3.75% respectively. Governor Perry Warjiyo said the central bank still sees room for further rate cuts, but the current focus is on maintaining the stability of the rupiah exchange rate and strengthening the effectiveness of monetary policy transmission that has been pursued previously. Perry urged banks to accelerate the reduction of loan interest rates. He noted that the BI Rate has fallen by 150 basis points since September 2024, but bank loan rates only fell by 15 basis points from 9.20% at the start of 2025 to 9.05% in September 2025. A similar situation occurred with the third-party deposit (DPK) rate, which only fell by 29 basis points from 4.81% to 4.52%, mainly because a special rate for large depositors still accounts for 26% of total bank DPK. To speed up monetary policy transmission, Bank Indonesia will expand macro-prudential liquidity incentive provisions from 1 December 2025, granting incentives to banks that lower their loan rates. The incentive can be up to 0.5% of DPK, depending on the elasticity of the bank's loan-rate reduction to the BI Rate cut. Meanwhile, the liquidity incentive linked to credit to priority sectors remains at 5% of DPK but will be applied on a forward-looking basis, based on future credit commitment, instead of the previous backward-looking approach. This change is expected to stimulate faster credit growth. The decision to keep rates unchanged comes as Indonesia's foreign-exchange reserves fell to USD 148.7 billion at the end of September 2025, marking a three-month consecutive decline and the lowest level in 14 months. The reserve drawdown could limit Bank Indonesia's ability to support rupiah stability. Key takeaway: besides focusing on monetary transmission, the rate hold was taken before the APEC Summit meeting between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping (31 Oct-1 Nov 2025), which could affect market volatility and outlook.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Danantara is considering creating a national asset manager by merging asset-management units from Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI). The combined assets under management of the three banks' units total nearly USD 8 billion at the beginning of 2025. Bloomberg sources said Danantara aims to finalize the plan in Q1 2026, but discussions are ongoing and no final decision has been made. Representatives of Danantara, BBRI, BMRI, and BBNI have not commented. Bank Indonesia recorded that bank credit growth reached +7.7% YoY for 9M25 (vs. +7.56% YoY for 8M25 and +10.85% YoY for 9M24), lower than the 2025 target range of +8-11% YoY. Governor Perry Warjiyo explained that credit demand remains weak due to a "wait and see" attitude among businesses, internal financing by corporations, and relatively high loan rates. Undisbursed loan facilities remained high at 22.54% of total credit limits in September 2025 (vs. 22.71% in 8M25). Investment credit grew +15.18% YoY, consumption credit +7.42% YoY, and working-capital credit +3.37% YoY. UMKM and Sharia financing slowed to +0.23% YoY and +7.55% YoY respectively. Bank Indonesia expects credit growth to stay at the lower end of the 2025 target range and to pick up in 2026. Spot gold prices fell sharply by 6.3% to USD 4,082.03 per ounce on Tuesday (21/10), the biggest intraday drop since June 2013, before closing down 5.3% at USD 4,125.22. This was the largest daily percentage decline since August 2020, driven by profit-taking as investors feared the recent gold rally was overvalued. On Wednesday (22/10) gold fell another 1.6% to around USD 4,058 per ounce. Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) recorded gas sales of 833 BBTU for 9M25, down 2% YoY and 4-13% below the 2025 target range of 873-958 BBTU. Gas transmission volume reached 1,622 MMSCFD (+6% YoY), exceeding the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD. Upstream gas sales were 16,892 BOEPD, down 16% YoY and 2% below the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD. Pakuwon Jati (PWON) lowered its 2025 marketing-sales target from IDR 1.8 trillion to IDR 1.35 trillion. For 9M25, PWON posted marketing sales of about IDR 903 billion, a 20% YoY decline. ADHI's corporate secretary Rozi Sparta said the company recorded new contracts worth IDR 6.5 trillion in 9M25, down 54% YoY, representing 23-26% of the 2025 target range of IDR 25-28 trillion. The new contracts came from building projects (52%), natural resources (17%), transportation infrastructure (11%), and other sectors.

tickerNews.title: FUTR signs MoU for 130 MW solar project in Bali
tickerNews.content: Futura Energi Global signed a strategic cooperation memorandum of understanding with Zhejiang Energy PV-Tech Co. Ltd. and PT Hypec International to develop a 130 MW solar power plant (PLTS) in Bali. CEO Tonny Agus Mulyantono said the company is coordinating with the Bali regional government to select a suitable site that fits spatial planning and local potential. FUTR will establish a dedicated subsidiary to handle operation and maintenance of the PLTS. Documentation, feasibility study, and licensing are targeted to be completed in the first half of 2026, after which construction can begin.

tickerNews.title: BMRI spin-off of Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) pending RUPSLB
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Danantara is arranging a shareholders meeting (RUPSLB) for Bank Mandiri to decide on the spin-off of Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) from BMRI. After the corporate action is completed, BRIS will be under Danantara's direct control. The RUPSLB is expected to be held this year. BRIS CEO Anggoro Eko Cahyo said the spin-off is within shareholders' authority.

tickerNews.title: WIFI partners with TBIG and CENT to develop broadband wireless access
tickerNews.content: WIFI's Director of Digital Solutions, Shannedy Ong, said the company has partnered with Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) and PT Centratama Menara Indonesia (CENT), a subsidiary of Centratama Telekomunikasi Indonesia, to develop broadband wireless access. The cooperation follows WIFI's win in the 1.4 GHz frequency band auction for regional zone 1. With this partnership, WIFI does not need to build its own towers to expand the internet network. If infrastructure capacity remains insufficient, WIFI may cooperate with Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL) or Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR).

tickerNews.title: RAJA signs agreement to acquire gas trading company and explores LNGC, VLGC and renewable energy acquisitions
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja disclosed in its public expose that a subsidiary has signed an agreement to acquire a gas trading company operating in Banten, without further details. RAJA is also conducting due diligence to acquire two shipping companies that operate two liquefied natural gas carriers (LNGC) and one very large gas carrier (VLGC). Additionally, RAJA is performing due diligence to acquire several new renewable energy power plants, such as hydro and biomass facilities, and to acquire a water supply system in the Greater Jakarta area.

tickerNews.title: SGER plans nickel matte converter diversification with Indonesian smelter
tickerNews.content: Sumber Global Energy's CEO Welly Thomas said the company plans to diversify its business by exploring opportunities in nickel processing together with an Indonesian smelter. The discussion focuses on building a nickel matte converter that would raise nickel grade from the current 20-30% to 65-75%, thereby increasing nickel selling prices. Thomas believes high-grade nickel remains very promising, supported by growing global demand for electric vehicles and renewable-energy technologies.

tickerNews.title: BSDE reports 3Q25 marketing sales of about IDR 2 trillion (+1% YoY, -24% QoQ)
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of approximately IDR 2 trillion in 3Q25, up 1% YoY but down 24% QoQ. The result brings 9M25 marketing sales to IDR 7.1 trillion, a 4% YoY increase, equal to 71% of the 2025 target of IDR 10 trillion. The largest contribution came from the residential segment (44.2%), followed by retail (26.5%), commercial (15.2%), apartments (5.2%), and land-sale to joint ventures (8.9%).

tickerNews.title: PTRO records net profit of USD 5.9 million in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: Petrosea reported a net profit of USD 5.9 million in 3Q25 (versus USD 0.2 million in 2Q25 and USD 1.5 million in 3Q24). The result brings 9M25 net profit to USD 6.9 million, below the Stockbit estimate of 51% of the 2025 forecast. Net profit in 3Q25 was driven by a currency gain of USD 17.2 million (versus a loss of USD 10.4 million in 2Q25 and a loss of USD 8.3 million in 3Q24). Operationally, EBITDA reached USD 38.6 million in 3Q25 (+7% YoY, -18% QoQ), resulting in 9M25 EBITDA of USD 109.7 million (+32% YoY), also below the 2025 forecast (65% of Stockbit estimate, 54% of management guidance).
